courses.title: Problem-Solving & Algorithmic Thinking
courses.description: This course introduces students to the fundamentals of problem-solving within computing contexts. Students will study how to analyse problems, model them, and design systematic procedures (algorithms) to arrive at solutions. Topics include: the nature of problems and strategies for solving them (e.g., trial and error, heuristics, means-ends analysis), computational approaches (brute-force, divide-and-conquer, dynamic programming, randomized methods), and algorithm representation techniques (flowcharts, pseudocode). The aim is to equip students with the logic, structure and methodology necessary to approach and solve routine and non-routine problems in software and computing environments.

courses.title: Elementary Mathematics I
courses.description: This course introduces foundational mathematical concepts for students beginning tertiary-level study. Topics usually include set theory, the real number system, algebraic expressions and operations, quadratic equations, sequences and series, complex numbers, trigonometric functions, and binomial theorem. The aim is to develop students’ ability to apply mathematical techniques to solve problems in science, engineering, or general mathematical contexts.

courses.title: Application of Computer in Business
courses.description: The course is designed to help business, governance and education managers understand computers and their applications in daily operations. It covers computer basics (definitions, classes, and categories), hardware, software, operating systems, applications systems, database management, life-cycle of systems development, networks, the Internet, security, health & safety, and the role of ICT in business efficiency and development.

courses.title: Introduction to Operating Systems
courses.description: This course provides a study of operating system concepts and design. It covers the definition and functions of an operating system, its evolution and major design considerations, different types of operating systems (e.g., single-user, multitasking, real-time, distributed), process management (including threads and CPU scheduling), process synchronization (race conditions, mutual exclusion, critical section problems), deadlock and its handling, and memory management techniques such as paging, segmentation and contiguous allocation.

courses.title: Introduction to Object-Oriented Programming
courses.description: This course introduces the basic concepts and techniques of object-oriented programming (OOP). It covers classes and objects, encapsulation, message passing, inheritance, polymorphism, abstraction, composition, static behaviours, constructors/destructors, and operator overloading using languages such as Java and C#.

courses.title: Number Theory
courses.description: This course explores some of the arithmetic properties of the integers, including number‐theoretic functions, congruences, Diophantine equations, quadratic residues, and classically important problems.

courses.title: Advanced Database Systems
courses.description: This course builds upon foundational database concepts to explore advanced database topics. Students will study database administration, optimization, and modern database technologies. Topics include: query optimization, indexing strategies, distributed databases, database security and recovery, NoSQL databases, data warehousing, and database performance tuning. The course prepares students for professional database administration and design roles.

courses.title: ORGANIZATION OF PROGRAMMING LANGUAGES
courses.description: This course explores the fundamental principles and techniques involved in the design, implementation and organization of programming languages. Topics include the concept and evolution of programming languages; programming language paradigms (e.g., procedural, object-oriented, functional, logic); language classification and features; language syntax and semantics; data types and data structures; translation phases, compilers and interpreters; and the evaluation and selection of appropriate programming languages for different applications.

courses.title: Microcomputers and Microprocessors
courses.description: Development of mobile applications for Android and iOS platforms. Topics include mobile UI/UX design, platform-specific development, cross-platform frameworks, mobile databases, and app deployment to app stores.

courses.title: Website Design & Programming
courses.description: This course provides comprehensive training in professional website design and programming. Students will learn to create dynamic, database-driven websites using modern web technologies and best practices. Topics include: advanced HTML5 and CSS3 techniques, JavaScript and jQuery for interactivity, responsive and mobile-first design principles, content management systems (CMS), server-side scripting with PHP or similar languages, MySQL database integration, web security considerations, SEO optimization, and web standards compliance. The course emphasizes practical project-based learning, where students design and develop complete, functional websites from conception to deployment. Students will gain experience with modern development tools, version control, and web hosting environments.
